TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit PipeStream extends System.IO.Stream
Public MustInherit Class PipeStream Inherits Stream
public ref class PipeStream abstract : System::IO::Stream
.class public auto ansi abstract PipeStream extends System.IO.Stream

summary.span: 公开管道周围的 对象，该对象同时支持匿名管道和命名管道。

span.span: Exposes a object around a pipe, which supports both anonymous and named pipes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类为 .NET Framework 中的命名和匿名管道操作提供基类。The class provides the base class for named and anonymous pipes operations in the .NET Framework. 将 和 类用于命名管道操作。Use the and classes for named pipe operations. 将 和 类用于匿名管道操作。Use the and classes for anonymous pipe operations. 有关管道的详细信息，请参阅[管道](~/docs/standard/io/pipe-operations.md)。For more information about pipes, see [Pipes](~/docs/standard/io/pipe-operations.md). 有关匿名管道的示例，请参阅[如何：使用匿名管道进行本地进程间通信](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-use-anonymous-pipes-for-local-interprocess-communication.md)。For an example of anonymous pipes, see [How to: Use Anonymous Pipes for Local Interprocess Communication](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-use-anonymous-pipes-for-local-interprocess-communication.md). 有关命名管道的示例，请参阅[如何：使用命名管道进行网络进程间通信](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-use-named-pipes-for-network-interprocess-communication.md)。For an example of named pipes, see [How to: Use Named Pipes for Network Interprocess Communication](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-use-named-pipes-for-network-interprocess-communication.md).

summary.span: 初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class.

param.name: buffer
param.span: 将数据读入的缓冲区。

span.span: The buffer to read data into.

param.name: offset
param.span: 中的字节偏移量，从此处开始读取。

span.span: The byte offset in at which to begin reading.

param.name: count
param.span: 要读取的最大字节数。

span.span: The maximum number of bytes to read.

param.name: callback
param.span: 异步读操作完成后调用的方法。

span.span: The method to call when the asynchronous read operation is completed.

param.name: state
param.span: 用户提供的对象，用于将此特定异步读取请求与其他请求区分开来。

span.span: A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous read request from other requests.

summary.span: 开始执行异步读取操作。

span.span: Begins an asynchronous read operation.

returns.span: 引用异步读取的 对象。

span.span: An object that references the asynchronous read.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 将返回的 对象传递到 方法以确定读取的字节数，以及释放用于读取的操作系统资源。Pass the returned object to the method to determine how many bytes were read and to release operating system resources used for reading. 对于每次调用 ，都必须调用 一次。 must be called once for every call to . 这可以在调用 的同一代码中完成，也可以在传递给 的回调中完成。This can be done either in the same code that called or in a callback that is passed to . 使用 属性来确定当前 对象是否支持读操作。Use the property to determine whether the current object supports read operations. 如果关闭管道或将无效参数传递到 ，则会立即引发相应的异常。If the pipe is closed or an invalid argument is passed to , the appropriate exceptions are raised immediately. 在执行请求的线程池线程上发生异步读取请求期间发生的错误。Errors that occur during an asynchronous read request occur on the thread pool thread that is performing the request. 当代码调用 方法时，将引发异常。The exceptions are raised when the code calls the method.

span.span: is .
is less than 0.
-or-
is less than 0.

exception.span: 大于 中可用的字节数。

span.span: is greater than the number of bytes available in .
The pipe is closed.
The pipe does not support read operations.

exception.span: 管道已断开连接，正在等待连接，或尚未设置句柄。

span.span: The pipe is disconnected, waiting to connect, or the handle has not been set.

exception.span: 管道已损坏或出现其他 I/O 错误。

span.span: The pipe is broken or another I/O error occurred.

Protected Overrides Sub Dispose (disposing As Boolean)

param.name: disposing
param.span: 如果为 ，则托管及非托管资源都释放；如果为 ，则仅释放非托管资源。

span.span: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

summary.span: 释放 类使用的非托管资源，并可以选择释放托管资源。

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the class and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法由 public 方法和 方法调用。This method is called by the public method and the method. 调用受保护的 方法，并将 `disposing` 参数设置为 `true`。 invokes the protected method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`. 调用 `disposing` 设置为 `false`的 。 invokes with `disposing` set to `false`. 当释放参数 `true`时，此方法将释放此 对象引用的任何托管对象所持有的所有资源。When the disposing parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this object references. 此方法将调用每个被引用对象的 方法。This method invokes the method of each referenced object.

para.span: 在派生类中，将所有 清理逻辑放在 方法中。

span.span: In derived classes, put all cleanup logic in the method.

para.span: 可以由其他对象多次调用。

span.span: can be called multiple times by other objects.

para.span: 重写 时，请注意不要引用在以前调用 时已释放的对象。

span.span: When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to .

para.span: 有关如何实现 的详细信息，请参阅[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。

span.span: For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).

para.span: 有关 和 的详细信息，请参阅[清理非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)。

span.span: For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法返回对 的之前调用指定的字节数组中读取的字节数。This method returns the number of bytes read into the byte array specified by the earlier call to . 将返回的 对象传递到 方法以确定读取的字节数，以及释放用于读取的操作系统资源。Pass the returned object to the method to determine how many bytes were read and to release operating system resources used for reading. 对于每次调用 ，都必须调用 一次。 must be called once for every call to . 这可以在调用 的同一代码中完成，也可以在传递给 的回调中完成。This can be done either in the same code that called or in a callback that is passed to . 使用 属性来确定当前 对象是否支持读操作。Use the property to determine whether the current object supports read operations. 如果关闭管道或将无效参数传递到 ，则会立即引发相应的异常。If the pipe is closed or an invalid argument is passed to , the appropriate exceptions are raised immediately. 在执行请求的线程池线程上发生异步读取请求期间发生的错误。Errors that occur during an asynchronous read request occur on the thread pool thread that is performing the request. 当代码调用 方法时，将引发异常。The exceptions are raised when the code calls the method.

summary.span: 清除当前流的缓冲区，并使所有缓冲的数据都写入到基础设备。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 访问控制列表（ACL）介绍了在指定文件上执行特定操作的权限，或不具有权限的个人和/或组。An access control list (ACL) describes individuals and/or groups that have, or do not have, rights to perform specific actions on a specified file. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：添加或移除访问控制列表项](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md)。For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md).

span.span: The pipe is closed.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int Read (Span<byte> buffer);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 Read(valuetype System.Span`1<unsigned int8> buffer) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Read (buffer As Span(Of Byte)) As Integer
public: override int Read(Span<System::Byte> buffer);
override this.Read : Span<byte> -> int

param.name: buffer
param.span: 内存的区域。

span.span: A region of memory.

param.span: 当此方法返回时，此区域的内容将替换为从当前源读取的字节。

span.span: When this method returns, the contents of this region are replaced by the bytes read from the current source.

summary.span: 从当前流中读取一个字节序列，将其写入字节数组，并按读取的字节数向前移动流中的位置。

span.span: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream, writes them to a byte array, and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.

returns.span: 读入 中的总字节数。

span.span: The total number of bytes read into the .

returns.span: 如果很多字节当前不可用，则这可小于在 中分配的字节数；如果已到达流结尾，则为零 (0)。

span.span: This can be less than the number of bytes allocated in if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用 属性来确定当前 对象是否支持读操作。Use the property to determine whether the current object supports read operations. 使用 方法从当前流中异步读取。Use the method to read asynchronously from the current stream. 此方法从当前流中读取最多 `buffer.Length` 个字节，并将它们存储在 `buffer`中。This method reads a maximum of `buffer.Length` bytes from the current stream and stores them in `buffer`. 流中的当前位置按读取的字节数提前;但是，如果发生异常，则流中的当前位置将保持不变。The current position within the stream is advanced by the number of bytes read; however, if an exception occurs, the current position within the stream remains unchanged. 如果没有数据可用，则此方法将被阻止，直到至少有一个字节的数据可供读取。This method will block until at least one byte of data can be read, in the event that no data is available. 仅当流中没有更多的数据，但不需要更多的数据（如闭合的套接字或文件尾）时，此方法才返回0。This method returns 0 only when there is no more data in the stream and no more is expected (such as a closed socket or end of file). 即使尚未到达流的末尾，此方法也可以自由返回比所请求的更少的字节。This method is free to return fewer bytes than requested even if the end of the stream has not been reached. 使用 `BinaryReader` 读取基元数据类型。Use `BinaryReader` for reading primitive data types.

exception.span: 读取的字节数长于缓冲区长度。

span.span: The number of bytes read was longer than the buffer length.

span.span: The byte offset in the array at which the bytes that are read will be placed.

param.span: 要读取的最大字节数。

span.span: The maximum number of bytes to read.

summary.span: 从指定长度的指定位置开始，从流中读取一个字节块，并将数据写入指定的缓冲区。

span.span: Reads a block of bytes from a stream and writes the data to a specified buffer starting at a specified position for a specified length.

returns.span: 读取到 的总字节数。

span.span: The total number of bytes that are read into .

returns.span: 如果当前可用的字节数没有请求的那么多，则此数小于请求的字节数；或如果已到达流的末尾，则为零。

span.span: This might be less than the number of bytes requested if that number of bytes is not currently available, or 0 if the end of the stream is reached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用 属性来确定当前 对象是否支持读操作。Use the property to determine whether the current object supports read operations. 调用 方法将会阻止，直到读取 `count` 字节或到达流的末尾。Calling the method blocks until `count` bytes are read or the end of the stream is reached. 有关异步读取操作，请参阅 和 。For asynchronous read operations, see and . ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个匿名管道客户端和管道服务器。The following example creates an anonymous pipe client and pipe server. 管道服务器使用 方法将管道客户端中的一系列字节作为验证代码进行读取。The pipe server uses the method to read a series of bytes from the pipe client as a validation code. 管道客户端和管道服务器都属于同一示例。Both the pipe client and the pipe server are part of the same example. 该示例的服务器部分创建一个客户端进程，并将匿名管道句柄作为参数传递。The server portion of the example creates a client process and passes it an anonymous pipe handle as an argument. [!code-cpp[System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.io.pipes.pipestream/cpp/sample.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.io.pipes.pipestream/cs/sample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.io.pipes.pipestream/vb/sample.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask<int> ReadAsync (Memory<byte> buffer, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask`1<int32> ReadAsync(valuetype System.Memory`1<unsigned int8> buffer, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
Public Overrides Function ReadAsync (buffer As Memory(Of Byte), Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = null) As ValueTask(Of Integer)
override this.ReadAsync : Memory<byte> * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask<int>

param.name: buffer
param.span: 要将数据写入的内存区域。

span.span: The region of memory to write the data into.

param.name: cancellationToken
param.span: 要监视的取消请求标记。

span.span: The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

param.span: 默认值是 。

span.span: The default value is .

summary.span: 从当前流异步读取字节的序列，将其写入字节内存范围，按读取的字节数向前移动流中的位置，并监视取消请求。

span.span: Asynchronously reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream, writes them to a byte memory range, advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read, and monitors cancellation requests.

returns.span: 表示异步读取操作的任务。

span.span: A task that represents the asynchronous read operation.

returns.span: 其 属性的值包含读入缓冲区的总字节数。

span.span: The value of its property contains the total number of bytes read into the buffer.

returns.span: 如果很多字节当前不可用，则结果值可小于在缓冲区中分配的字节数；如果已到达流结尾，则结果值可以为 0（零）。

span.span: The result value can be less than the number of bytes allocated in the buffer if that many bytes are not currently available, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 利用 方法，你可以在不阻塞主线程的情况下执行占用大量资源的 i/o 操作。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive I/O operations without blocking the main thread. 在 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 应用或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 应用中一个耗时的流操作可能阻塞 UI 线程并让您的应用看起来好像不工作时，这种性能的考虑就显得尤为重要了。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 异步方法与 Visual Basic 和C#中的 `async` 和 `await` 关键字结合使用。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 使用 属性可确定当前实例是否支持读取。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports reading. 如果在操作完成前取消该操作，则返回的任务将包含 属性的 值。If the operation is canceled before it completes, the returned task contains the value for the property.

span.span: The stream does not support reading.

The pipe hasn't been connected yet.
-or-

span.span: The result value can be less than the number of bytes requested if the number of bytes currently available is less than the requested number, or it can be 0 (zero) if the end of the stream has been reached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 利用 方法，你可以在不阻塞主线程的情况下执行占用大量资源的 i/o 操作。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive I/O operations without blocking the main thread. 在 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 应用或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 应用中一个耗时的流操作可能阻塞 UI 线程并让您的应用看起来好像不工作时，这种性能的考虑就显得尤为重要了。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 异步方法与 Visual Basic 和C#中的 `async` 和 `await` 关键字结合使用。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 使用 属性可确定当前实例是否支持读取。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports reading. 如果在操作完成前取消该操作，则返回的任务将包含 属性的 值。If the operation is canceled before it completes, the returned task contains the value for the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 访问控制列表（ACL）介绍了在指定文件上执行特定操作的权限，或不具有权限的个人和/或组。An access control list (ACL) describes individuals and/or groups that have, or do not have, rights to perform specific actions on a specified file. 有关详细信息，请参阅[如何：添加或移除访问控制列表项](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md)。For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](~/docs/standard/io/how-to-add-or-remove-access-control-list-entries.md).

param.name: buffer

span.span: A region of memory.

param.span: 此方法将此区域的内容复制到当前流。

span.span: This method copies the contents of this region to the current stream.

summary.span: 将字节序列写入当前流，并按写入的字节数向前调整流的当前位置。

span.span: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用 属性可确定当前实例是否支持写入。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports writing. 使用 方法异步写入当前流。Use the method to write asynchronously to the current stream. 如果写入操作成功，则流中的位置将按写入的字节数向前推进。If the write operation is successful, the position within the stream advances by the number of bytes written. 如果发生异常，则流中的位置将保持不变。If an exception occurs, the position within the stream remains unchanged.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask WriteAsync (ReadOnlyMemory<byte> buffer, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask WriteAsync(valuetype System.ReadOnlyMemory`1<unsigned int8> buffer, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed
Public Overrides Function WriteAsync (buffer As ReadOnlyMemory(Of Byte), Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = null) As ValueTask
override this.WriteAsync : ReadOnlyMemory<byte> * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask

param.name: buffer
param.span: 从中写入数据的内存区域。

span.span: The region of memory to write data from.

param.name: cancellationToken
param.span: 要监视的取消请求标记。

span.span: The token to monitor for cancellation requests.

param.span: 默认值是 。

span.span: The default value is .

summary.span: 将字节的序列异步写入当前流，将该流中的当前位置向前移动写入的字节数，并监视取消请求。

span.span: Asynchronously writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream, advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written, and monitors cancellation requests.

returns.span: 表示异步写入操作的任务。

span.span: A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 利用 方法，你可以在不阻塞主线程的情况下执行占用大量资源的 i/o 操作。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive I/O operations without blocking the main thread. 在 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 应用或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 应用中一个耗时的流操作可能阻塞 UI 线程并让您的应用看起来好像不工作时，这种性能的考虑就显得尤为重要了。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 异步方法与 Visual Basic 和C#中的 `async` 和 `await` 关键字结合使用。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 使用 属性可确定当前实例是否支持写入。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports writing. 如果在操作完成前取消该操作，则返回的任务将包含 属性的 值。If the operation is canceled before it completes, the returned task contains the value for the property.

span.span: Stream does not support writing.

summary.span: 从字节数组的指定位置开始异步写入指定字节数，按写入的字节数向前移动此流中的当前位置，并监视取消请求。

span.span: Asynchronously writes a specified number of bytes from a byte array starting at a specified position, advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written, and monitors cancellation requests.

returns.span: 表示异步写入操作的任务。

span.span: A task that represents the asynchronous write operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 利用 方法，你可以在不阻塞主线程的情况下执行占用大量资源的 i/o 操作。The method enables you to perform resource-intensive I/O operations without blocking the main thread. 在 [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] 应用或 [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] 应用中一个耗时的流操作可能阻塞 UI 线程并让您的应用看起来好像不工作时，这种性能的考虑就显得尤为重要了。This performance consideration is particularly important in a [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] app or [!INCLUDE[desktop_appname](~/includes/desktop-appname-md.md)] app where a time-consuming stream operation can block the UI thread and make your app appear as if it is not working. 异步方法与 Visual Basic 和C#中的 `async` 和 `await` 关键字结合使用。The async methods are used in conjunction with the `async` and `await` keywords in Visual Basic and C#. 使用 属性可确定当前实例是否支持写入。Use the property to determine whether the current instance supports writing. 如果在操作完成前取消该操作，则返回的任务将包含 属性的 值。If the operation is canceled before it completes, the returned task contains the value for the property.
